title: Ninety Six National Historic Site: Mammals
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Animals     Mammals                Mammals       During a mammal survey conducted in the 2000s, 18 species of terrestrial mammals were recorded, and 393 individual observations of mammals were made. Documented mammals include: the Virginia opposum, shrews, rodents, squirrel, rats/mice/voles, Eastern cottontail rabbit, fox, raccoon, beaver, deer, coyote, and bobcat. All species found during the survey are relatively widespread and considered common in South Carolina.
